column4: is there a way to prevent proprietary modules (which taint the kernel) from loading? I need to prevent ltmodem from loading.
put the modules in /etc/modprobe.d/blacklist IIRC
thanks. I'll check it out. What about when booting from livecd?
you might want to look at gnewsense :) see http://www.gnewsense.org/
there's a toorent - it's an RMS friendly live CD :)
if you want a taint-free live CD that's the one - I'm seeding it with about 6 others
thanks, i'll certainly give it a try. What's the popular distro it's based on?
Ubuntu of course :)
it's actually Ubuntu without the restricted bits and including emacs ;-)
I aaume emacs is to keep Richard happy ;-)
great 8^]  why the secrecy though? Also google and wikipedia don't know anything about it. How often does that happen!!!
ah, I asume that's you in the torrent now
heh - I only found out about it a few days ago
yep :) going 350KB/s which is as much as my adsl can handle :)
it's veryu early days, that's all - please help with the seeding :)
cool - most of that is coming from here then :)
ah , sorry - about a tenth from here - I misread :)
seeding, sure. that just means leaving ktorrent open right?
yep
let's write a wikipedia stub about it
you might want to talk to ompaul in #ubuntu-ops - I don't know much about it yet
